item.title: Several deep potholes in the road that are never filled it properly and therefore they break up, 16th November
item.description:
Several deep potholes in the dead end section of Highview Road in Sidcup. These need to be filled in but instead of doing the usual ‘chuck the tarmac loosely out of a bag and hope for the best’ as the Council usually do, how about actually filling these potholes in properly as the repair never lasts more than a few weeks before it then rains and turns into the Rivers of Babylon again. Boney M could perform live with the potholes filled with rainwater, loose debris and gravel all over the road and the dirty kerbsides with leaves, rubbish and more gravel and loose debris. Yes the road is due to be resurfaced next year but at least come and sort out these potholes and the rubbish please before myself or another elderly neighbour falls flat on their arse soon enough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Highview Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent flooding in rainy weather, 16th November
item.description:
This area is prone to persistent flooding whenever there is heavy rain, despite there being a double drain there. I had a look this evening, and it looks as though the drain is partially blocked below the drain cover, which may be partly what is causing the problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deterioration of bricked speed bump, 16th November
item.description:
Ramped edge of brick speed bump has deteriorated and is almost equivalent of driving up/down a kerb. Has been like this for a couple of months and is slowly getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gibbon Road, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy and loitering bar patrons from bath house bar and loitering outside peoples homes, 16th November
item.description:
The bath house bar is incredibly inconsiderate to the neighbourhood and it's residents. I found this roasted chicken on the floor and parking spaces overrun by lime bikes. Drunk people were also loitering around in groups. Every saturday it is like this.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking entire vehicle on pavement/footpath, 16th November
item.description:
The seemingly 'self-entitled' owner of this car has illegally parked on the public pavement. Clearly they need to be instructed that such practice is not permitted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Chase Side, Enfield, London Borough of Enfield
